entities.name: Bensalem
entities.definition: Island kingdom, isolated by vast seas, with Christian inhabitants practicing advanced natural philosophy

evidence.quote: We of this island of Bensalem, (for so they call it in their language,) have this; that by means of our solitary situation; and of the laws of secrecy... we know well most part of the habitable world, and are ourselves unknown

entities.name: Salomon's House
entities.definition: Scientific college dedicated to studying God's works and creatures, the 'very eye of this kingdom'

evidence.quote: the noblest foundation (as we think) that ever was upon the earth; and the lanthorn of this kingdom. It is dedicated to the study of the Works and Creatures of God

entities.name: King Solamona
entities.definition: Ancient lawgiver king with 'large heart' who established Bensalem's isolation and institutions

evidence.quote: a king, whose memory of all others we most adore; not superstitiously, but as a divine instrument, though a mortal man; his name was Solamona: and we esteem him as the lawgiver of our nation

entities.name: Strangers' House
entities.definition: Institution providing hospitality and quarantine for foreign visitors to Bensalem

evidence.quote: The Strangers' House is a fair and spacious house, built of brick... they having cast it that four of those chambers... might receive four of the principal men

entities.name: Father of Salomon's House
entities.definition: Senior member who explains the institution's purpose, methods, and organization to visitors

evidence.quote: God bless thee, my son; I will give thee the greatest jewel I have. For I will impart unto thee, for the love of God and men, a relation of the true state of Salomon's House

entities.name: Natural Philosophy
entities.definition: Systematic investigation of nature's causes and motions through experiment and observation

evidence.quote: The End of our Foundation is the knowledge of causes, and secret motions of things; and the enlarging of the bounds of human empire, to the effecting of all things possible

step1.notes: Core entities central to Bensalem governance and knowledge

morphisms.statement: King Solamona erected and instituted Salomon's House as noblest foundation

evidence.quote: amongst the excellent acts of that king, one above all hath the pre-eminence. It was the erection and institution of an Order or Society, which we call Salomon's House

morphisms.statement: Salomon's House serves as the very eye of the kingdom of Bensalem

evidence.quote: which house, or college (my good brethren) is the very eye of this kingdom

morphisms.statement: Natural philosophy provides the method and purpose for Salomon's House operations

evidence.quote: The End of our Foundation is the knowledge of causes, and secret motions of things

morphisms.statement: Strangers' House controls and filters external contact with Bensalem

evidence.quote: the custom of the land requireth, that after this day and to-morrow... you are to keep within doors for three days

morphisms.statement: Father interprets and directs the practice of natural philosophy

olog.name: Bensalem's Scientific Governance
axioms: Knowledge of natural causes enables human dominion over nature
Divine revelation authenticates scientific investigation of creation
Isolation preserves institutional integrity from foreign corruption
Organized experiment yields greater results than individual inquiry
Secrecy protects valuable knowledge from misuse by others
rules: IF strangers arrive THEN quarantine and assess before admission
IF natural phenomena observed THEN distinguish divine from natural causes
IF experiments conducted THEN organize by systematic division of labor
IF discoveries made THEN evaluate for publication or concealment

evidence.quote: The End of our Foundation is the knowledge of causes, and secret motions of things; and the enlarging of the bounds of human empire, to the effecting of all things possible
